title: 107_hr4884
content: The Act is titled the "Educator Appreciation and Classroom Help Act." It introduces a refundable credit for elementary and secondary school teachers under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The "Educator Appreciation and Classroom Help Act" allows a $1,000 tax credit for eligible teachers, including educators and home school teachers at the elementary or secondary level. The Act also includes technical amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The table of sections for subpart C of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking the last item and inserting new items. The amendments made by this section apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2002. The 2-percent floor on miscellaneous itemized deductions does not apply to qualified professional development expenses of elementary and secondary school teachers. The amendments allow a deduction for qualified professional development expenses of eligible educators, excluding them from the 2-percent floor on miscellaneous itemized deductions. The term 'qualified professional development expenses' includes expenses for tuition, fees, books, supplies, equipment, and transportation for enrollment in a qualified course of instruction. A qualified course of instruction is defined as a course at an institution of higher education. The term 'qualified professional development expenses' covers expenses for education or professional conferences that enhance teaching skills, approved by the local educational agency or the employing school. The term 'eligible educator' is defined as provided by 62(d)(1) and the effective date for the amendments made by this section is for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2002. Expansion of above-the-line deduction for classroom supplies of elementary and secondary school teachers. The tax code is being amended to permanently extend and increase deductions for employee business expenses. Private schools are now included in the coverage for certain deductions. Additionally, a new deduction is allowed for expenses of home school teachers. The tax code is being amended to permanently extend and increase deductions for employee business expenses, including private schools and home school teachers. Section 223 is redesignated as section 224, with a new section 222 added. "SEC. 223. HOME SCHOOL EXPENSES." Deduction for home school expenses allows eligible educators to deduct costs for books, supplies, and equipment up to $2,000. Eligible educators are individuals teaching at the elementary or secondary level in a home school. The amendment applies to taxable years starting after December 31, 2002.
